meanings.definition: A unit of length equal to 22 yards.
meanings.sent1: The football field measured one archine in length.
meanings.sent2: She walked an archine to reach the store.
meanings.sent3: The cat stretched an archine long, pretending to be a lion.
meanings.sent4: His patience was an archine, never-ending and vast.
meanings.sent5: The archine of the hallway seemed to go on forever.

meanings.definition: A unit of weight equal to 14 pounds.
meanings.sent1: The bag of rice weighed one archine.
meanings.sent2: He struggled to lift the archine of books.
meanings.sent3: The archine of apples was too heavy for the tiny squirrel to carry.
meanings.sent4: Her burden felt like an archine pressing down on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The archine of responsibility weighed heavily on his mind.

meanings.definition: A unit of volume equal to 231 cubic inches.
meanings.sent1: The container could hold one archine of water.
meanings.sent2: She poured an archine of sand into the jar.
meanings.sent3: The archine of popcorn popped out of the machine nonstop.
meanings.sent4: His laughter filled the room like an archine of joy.
meanings.sent5: The archine of tears spilled from her eyes in sorrow.
